page.title: 10Herrington Colliery
page.content: The deep coal mine at{Herrington {Colliery}is one of the last remaining Pits on the exposed sections of the {Durham Coalfield.}Mining is still one of the main employers in this area and the threatened closure of Herrington Pit could have a devastating effect on our small communities. The pit heap tends to dominate the small village of New Herrington and from near-by Penshaw Hill the pit and village are lost in the vast black mass of coal spoil. The neat and tidy rows of{terraced {houses,}Lanton Sreet, Fletcher Terrace and Railway Terrace flank the road that leads to the pit shaft and its towering winding wheel. It was for this pit and the community that the people of this area have just undergone twelve months of striking hardship.
